web-page.title: Documentation
web-page.p: The following documentation is available for . Note that at the current time, all the documentation listed below are works in progress (or not yet started). For the time being, I recommend the Quick Start.
The Programming Guide is not yet available.

The Discrete Event Simulation Framework is a library of classes, interfaces, and value types used in the creation of discrete event simulations. This guide provides detailed information on the types available for programmatic use.

This documentation was generated using the September Community Technical Preview (CTP) of Microsoft's Sandcastle documentation generator. Eric Woodruff's Sandcastle Help File Builder was used to create the on-line viewable pages.
